title: Canada claims North American championship
text:
Canada claims North American championship By: Uncredited Report Error 
Canada won its first NORCECA men’s continental championship Saturday after beating Cuba 3-1 (25-23, 19-25, 25-18, 25-17) in Cordoba, Mexico. 
Gord Perrin led Canada with 18 points on 15 kills and three blocks. Nicholas Hoag finished with 15 (11 kills, one block and three aces) and Justin Duff scored 12. 
Toon Van Lankvelt of Rivers played in the first three sets, while Dustin Schneider of Brandon played in the final three. Van Lankvelt scored four points for Canada, while Schneider had another. 
On Friday, the men earned their berth in the final by coming back after falling behind 2-1 in their match against Mexico with a five-set victory (20-25, 25-16, 18-25, 25-17, 15-7). Perrin led Canada with 21 points, while Hoag had 19 and Daniel Jansen Vandoorn contributed 14. 
Cuba defeated Puerto Rico 3-1 (20-25, 25-20, 25-23, 25-22) in the other semifinal. 
All four semifinal teams have already earned their ticket to an Olympic qualifier, tentatively scheduled for January 2016. 
In the team’s last event, the World Cup in Japan, Canada finished seventh as the U.S. and Italy earned Olympic berths.
